p: Heterogeneity in the preparation and injection methods used by published studies has also limited the ability to determine optimal PRP protocols. However, protocol characteristics of those RCTs that have reported positive effects on pain and function have generally utilised a single centrifugation at a slower speed (approximately 1500 g) for approximately 5 min to yield leucocyte poor PRP, and injected fresh PRP (i.e. not frozen and then thawed for subsequent injections) over 3 injections at weekly intervals [ 16]. There is some preliminary evidence to suggest younger patients, and those with less severe radiographic disease may experience greater symptomatic benefits [ 14, 17– 19].
